title: try_recv().expect(" ...  ") issue
body:
While tracing down a channel closed issue, I placed some try_recv().expect(" ...  ") calls and got a hit.  

The problem is there is no way (that I can think of) that this line of code can be the recv in question.

https://github.com/JeffMurray/must/blob/804206abfa55c457488cc63f78a3dc564e86dff8/src/must_bank.rs#L407

When I run the test, a typical output is like this:

running 1 test
Inserting 1000 documents.
test.json
documents submitted
reminder: check and delete test.json
test add_document_strand ... rust: task failed at '>> No way this can still be receiving? <<', /home/jeff/rust-0.7/src/libstd/option.rs:307
ok

result: rust: task failed at 'killed', /home/jeff/rust-0.7/src/libstd/pipes.rs:282
rust: task failed at 'killed', /home/jeff/rust-0.7/src/libstd/pipes.rs:282
rust: task failed at 'killed', /home/jeff/rust-0.7/src/libstd/pipes.rs:282
ok. 1 passed; 0 failed; 0 ignored

rust: task failed at 'killed', /home/jeff/rust-0.7/src/libstd/pipes.rs:282
rust: task failed at 'killed', /home/jeff/rust-0.7/src/libstd/pipes.rs:282
rust: task failed at 'killed', /home/jeff/rust-0.7/src/libstd/pipes.rs:282
rust: task failed at 'killed', /home/jeff/rust-0.7/src/libstd/pipes.rs:282

Although running this test requires a full build, it is just 10 or so files that compile with make all.

https://github.com/JeffMurray/must/tree/804206abfa55c457488cc63f78a3dc564e86dff8/src

Additional info:

https://github.com/JeffMurray/must/issues/3

Thanks.
